title: The Mortgage Refi Boom Is Running Out
sub_head: Lenders issued $859 billion in mortgages in the first quarter, down 25% from a year ago
body:
Rising interest rates dealt a critical blow to mortgage originations in the first quarter.
Lenders issued about $859 billion in mortgages in the first quarter, down 25% from the previous year, according to data released by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York on Tuesday.Â The quarter also marked the first time since early 2020 that originations fell below $1 trillion
